events.title: The Big Bang
events.description: The origin of the universe, leading to the creation of all matter, energy, and the fundamental forces of nature.

events.title: Formation of the Milky Way
events.description: The formation of the Milky Way galaxy from a massive gas cloud.

events.title: Formation of Heavy Elements
events.description: Supernovae created heavy elements necessary for planet formation and life.

events.title: Formation of the Solar System
events.description: The solar system formed from a rotating disk of gas and dust around the young Sun.

events.title: Formation of the Earth
events.description: The Earth formed from the dust and gas surrounding the young Sun.

events.title: Formation of the Moon
events.description: The Moon formed from the debris of a collision between Earth and a Mars-sized body.

events.title: Cooling of the Early Universe
events.description: The universe cooled, allowing protons and electrons to combine into hydrogen atoms.

events.title: Origin of Life
events.description: Life on Earth originated from simple organic compounds.

events.title: Great Oxygenation Event
events.description: Cyanobacteria began producing significant amounts of oxygen through photosynthesis.

events.title: Cambrian Explosion
events.description: A period of rapid diversification of life forms, leading to the development of most major animal phyla.

events.title: Emergence of Homo Sapiens
events.description: Homo sapiens evolved in Africa and eventually spread across the globe.

events.title: Out-of-Africa Migration
events.description: Early humans migrated out of Africa, spreading to different parts of the world.

events.title: Control of Fire
events.description: The mastery of fire by early humans.

events.title: Development of Tool Use
events.description: The use of stone tools by early humans.

events.title: Domestication of Animals
events.description: The domestication of animals by humans.

events.title: Agricultural Revolution
events.description: The transition from nomadic hunter-gatherer societies to settled agricultural communities.

events.title: The Fall of the Western Roman Empire
events.description: The collapse of the Western Roman Empire marked the beginning of the Middle Ages.

events.title: The Birth and Spread of Major Religions
events.description: Religious movements such as Christianity, Islam, and Buddhism have profoundly shaped civilizations, cultures, and conflicts throughout history.

events.title: The Development of Writing Systems
events.description: The invention of writing in Mesopotamia, Egypt, and other regions revolutionized human communication, record-keeping, and administration.

events.title: Alexander the Great's Conquests
events.description: Alexander the Great's campaigns created a vast empire and spread Greek culture across three continents.

events.title: Preventing World War II
events.description: Stopping the rise of Hitler and the Nazis could prevent the Holocaust and save millions of lives.

events.title: Stopping the Assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand
events.description: Preventing this event could potentially avert World War I, which reshaped the 20th century and set the stage for World War II.

events.title: Preventing the 9/11 Attacks
events.description: Avoiding this event could save thousands of lives and potentially change the course of global politics, security, and civil liberties.

events.title: Averting the Black Death
events.description: Stopping the plague that killed a significant portion of Europe's population in the 14th century could have profound demographic and social consequences.

events.title: Ending Colonialism Early
events.description: Intervening to end or prevent the colonization and exploitation of various regions could significantly alter the economic and political development of many countries.
